Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMcCartin
Reviews.Content: a beautiful hotel in a beautiful location, very friendly staff and excellent room. stayed in march 2011

Reviews.Title: “Will be recommending to family & friends!”
Reviews.Author: kwalling
Reviews.Content: 1. PERFECT location: close enough to Piazza San Marco w/o the noise & beautiful views of the adjacent canal from our lobby terrace. 2. AMAZING value: beautiful 3 star hotel including yummy breakfast where they will make you your own cup of espresso, cappucino, latte, etc. Yes, the rooms are smaller than we're accustomed to in other cities, but this is the case with rooms in Venice. Trust me, the room size is plenty large enough to accomplish what you need in a room. *In Italy, a 'double' bed is 2 twin beds together (yes, a 'king' as it is known in the states). 3. WONDERFUL service: not only did the staff accommodate us with a late check in (around 1 am), they printed out maps and highlighted directions to restaurants and places of interest we wished to find. ...don't waste your money on any other hotel in Venice. This is the best value for your money you can find!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: pipbin
Reviews.Content: We had a back room which looked onto an internal courtyard, but as we were out most of the time it really didn't matter. What did matter is that it was adjacent to what must be the main boiler flue which was surprisingly noisy. However, after walking for miles each day sleep came easily! The room was adequate and the bathroom was excellent and very clean. Staff were very helpful which must take some effort with such a high turnover. Breakfast was adequate but choice distinctly limited, and at peak times the space is just too small, so I recommend taking breakfast early to avoid the crush. I think on a return visit, having 'done' the main sights this time before the crowds in a sunny April, I would choose to stay on Dorsoduro which is so much less busy and yet extremely attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Always great!”
Reviews.Author: BREADandBUTTERitaly
Reviews.Content: Going to Venice for the second time, my boyfriend and I decided to stay at Violino d'Oro again. We chose the superior double room with view on the little square in front of the hotel and our impression from the previous visit has been completely confirmed. The location is perfect, 5 minutes walk from St Marco Square; the hotel staff is very kind and helpful (ask them if you want to go to Murano with their speedboat --- it's free); breakfast is rich and includes expressos drinks from the cafeteria, fresh and continental food; the room is not very big, but nothing is missing (wardrobe, hairdryer, minibar, TV) and it's very clean and comfortable. Our suggestion is to book in advance and check for special offers to get the best price.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable experience”
Reviews.Author: Aldo C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated walking distance away from St. Marco which is very good. I travelled with my family and arrived late in the evening on a cold night. We met a very cordial and friendly receptionist who immediately welcomed us with a smile. She asked for documentation whilst she gave us the hotel room key in order to get ourselves comfortable and she would personally take care of the documentation. I did understand her procedure as I work for a five star hotel and this was just great to me. Breakfast area is clean and serves were very attentive to detail and positive greeting. The room allocated to me was very spacious, comfortable and clean. Temperature was very satisfactory. Check out was handled as well by the same female receptionist, I am very sorry not to have her name but again her was excellent. I commend this three star hotel with a four star service to anyone visiting venice for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “La Serenissima in winter”
Reviews.Author: Liz and Arthur
Reviews.Content: We are just about to return for 2 more nights in this delightful hotel, located so conveniently just a short walk from Piazza San Marco. We stayed there for 2 nights just 10 days ago before our 2 week ski trip to the Dolomiti. Our room overlooked a canal and a gondola base. Early each morning we would see the gondoliers preparing their craft for the day. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed and the staff extremely helpful. January is a moody, romantic time to be in Venice and we were fortunate to have 2 glorious days of sunshine after a period of foggy days (we were told). Just be aware that many of the more well know restaurants close for a period between Christmas and Carnevale. We enjoyed the very local Vino Vino on both nights. It is so easy to walk everywhere and at this time of the year there are not a lot of tourists, and most are Italian. Clear days dictated a vaporetto ride to Burano (painted houses and lace work), and Torcello (stunningly beautiful mosaics in the church).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lilizav
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in January 2012, it is nice, cleane, friendly staff, good breakfast. BUT our room was very small with quiet old furniture, also the hotel has problems with sound proofing...but who want to sleep in Venice))) The location of this hotel is excellence!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than before”
Reviews.Author: dozydai
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel four years ago and wrote a review then, however after staying here at the beginning of December 2011,thought I would put my thoughts on a review again. The Violino d'oro is to me, about the best location you can get in Venice. Over the San Moise bridge, down the sal san moise and you are in St Marks , in the other direction,down calle largo xxii, 10 to 15 minute stroll gets you to the accedemia,passing on the way, my favourite watering hole in all of Venice, Tarnowskis bar, and through a narrow street with the best pizza sold from a little shop making it on site, cant remember the name,but I know where for the next time. On entering the hotel reception, you are brought back to the real venice, wonderful chandeliers and heavy drapes,and more importantly, great staff.The staff, especially Claudia, who seemed to be working every hour we were staying there are all very pleasent, and always willing to stop for a chat. The room on the second floor was the highlight, like walking back in time, big by venice hotel standards, more chandeliers, heavy drapes and flock wallpaper. there were 3 windows in the room, two looking down over the canal, and one, looking down over the san moise bridge. In the mornings, we would open the shutters and watch venice come to life, gondoliers sprussing up their craft ready for the days work. Then during the day , the bridge came to life with locals dashing back and forth, and the trippers and tourists getting their photo opportunities in,and listening to the singing as the gondolas swept past in a never ending train.We had only been there a few hours,and on return to the room, there was a bottle of prosecco and glasses to welcome us as return guests to our second home(claudias words not mine?) Breakfast was plentiful and good quality, and mention has been made in past reviews about the tea/coffee making machines, best coffee I had in Venice. there is a small bar, which seems to open at all hours, had a few drinks there in the evening before retiring , and am still waiting for the bill, its that sort of place.The hotel was spotlessly clean,and for 3 star, it is the best, why it is only in the sixties out of four hundred plus hotels in venice in the ratings, escapes me. In conclusion, for the price, a wonderful place to stay, we WILL return, and hopefully room 203 will be at our disposal again

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to Stay In Venice”
Reviews.Author: Leegns
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in late September and loved every minute of it. We had the most amazing room that looked over the square below. We arrived in the morning but were still able to check in early. This allowed us to have a quick nap before going out to explore the city. We had the corner room so it overlooked the canal on one side. We opened up the windows and shutters and could still sleep with the melee outside. And in doing so we were able to have quintessentially Venetian experience of being woken up hours later by an opera singer in a gondola below! We could NOT stop marvelling at the location and view from our room. I have booked my fair share of rooms online and always been slightly disappointed in one way or another but this hotel FAR exceeded my expectations! The morning breakfast had an amazing selection and they took great care of our luggage after we had checked out and before we left the city. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and highly recommend you do too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: DSP7578
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in an even better location! Less than a block from the San Marco Vaporetto stop...we had to ask to get there bc the street signs (if you find any) mean nothing. But no worries bc we asked along the way and people were incredibly friendly and helpful. Excellent location---next to a gondolier stop, 2 blocks from Piazza San Marco, and in the dead center of the most fabulous shopping area! The room was small but very clean and decorated very beautifully. The breakfast was continental but sufficient to start the day. Overall, the hotels's greatest asset was it's location. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “no lost! easy to reach from San Macro pier”
Reviews.Author: ooux
Reviews.Content: i was very lucky that booked this hotel, many of venice tourist lost coz can not locate their hotel, but this is just there! Great location and another lucky by update room from single to double!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Centralmaine
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel only 10 days prior my wife and I left for Italy for Thanksgiving. We were celebrating our birthdays, both in November, so I requested a view of the canal if they had it and we got it on the first floor. It is only a 2 minute walk to St. Marks and strangely enough, right next door to Ferragamo, Versace, Prada and many others. It is a main gondola stop so lots of tourists getting on and off, but it is not noisy in the least. It is funny to look out and see bumper to bumper gondolas heading out with the immense amount of Japanese tourists you will see throughout the city. Staff was lovely, breakfast was very good. The rooms were roomy enough. The only thing is that they use two twin beds to form a queen, but this is normal I guess. No big deal, we managed! LOL They had two new automatic coffee machines that gave you a myriad of various coffee choices which was very cool. We never used the bar but they have one if you want a glass of wine. A few floors had balcony access from the hall so you can easily access it to get cool shots like the ones you will see under this site. I would highly recommend this and I would not hesitate to come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view â€” Ferragamo & gondoliers”
Reviews.Author: KathiToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the hotel, and upgraded, I believe, to get a view. It, Room 102, was directly over the front door, so had a constant changing scene of gondoliers, and merchants. Not a huge room by any means, we had two single beds pushed together, but enough room to move around. It was lacking proper drawer storage, though we managed. Bathroom was renovated with a glass door shower, which made the bathroom appear less cramped. Maid service was very good, keeping us spic and span. Breakfast room offered a friendly staff, constantly restocking and clearing tables. Not sure if it was the food selections or the presentation that weren't terribly exciting, but filled us up for the morning none the less. Fresh orange juice was a bonus. Really appreciated the two coffee/cappuccino machines so we could make our own coffee, quickly, and refilled at our leisure. Front desk staff were all friendly, and helpful with tour bookings. Not the greatest Wi-Fi, and walked to an internet cafe instead. Great location! This is probably the best feature of the hotel. Less than a 5 minute walk to St. Mark's square and the vaporetto stands.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Canal!”
Reviews.Author: JCM05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Violino d'Oro for 3 nights the last week in September. Venice was a stretch for us because my wife is disabled, and the hotel staff truly did everything to make things as easy and enjoyable as possible. The hotel provided a wheelchair for us to use during our stay, and made all the arrangements for a water taxi to take us to the airport (including finding a landing site!). We particularly appreciated the efforts of Claudia who set it all up for us and the young man and woman who took our bags and us to the dock and got us on to the water taxi when we left. The hotel itself was very comfortable. We had the room set up for disabled access which overlooks the canal - very picturesque and you hear the gondoliers sing and play accordion. We closed the windows and so were not bothered by noise. The location is excellent - only a short distance from San Marco. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caro the greek
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Violino D'Oro,together with another couple,and we all had a wonderful time,and absolutely loved the hotel and all its staff,especially Romina,Claudia and David,who could not have been more helpful.We would return to Venice,just to stay there again.How lovely to arrive at the hotel late at night,to be greeted by a bottle of prosecco,waiting in our room.That was such a great welcome! And we loved having the gondola station right infront of the hotel,and watching the gondolas going by. All in all,a perfect hotel and a perfect location.Thanks to all the staff at the hotel. Carolyn Hadden

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay - wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Granitian
Reviews.Content: Great start to my vacation! We flew into Venice and stayed here only one night. The staff was great - very friendly, very helpful. Carried out bags in and out for us. They recommended a restaurant for dinner that was on of the top three meals I had in all of Italy! The room wasn't large but was very clean and well appointed. Fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT START TO WONDERFUL HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: jOHGLA
Reviews.Content: A 12 person all adult family that haven't seen eacch other for quit a few years can be rody but the management of Violino were so kind and courteous. The rooms (all superior) were all in the main hotel with beautiful views. Squeaky clean and well maintained. There were bottles of Italian wine and biscuits on the beds awaiting us, which added to our delight. Everybody were extremely friendly. This hotel is so near all the attractions that I have no hesitation in recommending it. The trip to Murano (included were def. not worthwhile, but maybe that is just our feeling. Everybody agreed over and over that we will return to Venice and definitely to the Violino d' Oro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay....close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: mich-ter
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took an Adriatic Cruise in May of 2011. We booked this hotel because we were arriving in Venice the day before our cruise and we wanted to be close to all the site seeing as we only had a short time to see so much. Although this hotel is somewhat expensive you are right at the heart of everything. The hotel is very clean and the location you cannot beat. The staff were fantastic! If you are on a budget as we were I would recommend this for one or two nights its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn60726
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a perfect spot...a short two blocks to Piazza San Marco. The staff went out of their way to assist us. The view is lovely as are so many in Venice. We looked out on a canal and a bridge and felt we were in heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice and loved it both times”
Reviews.Author: Charleypwd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located two blocks for the Piazza San Marco at a lovely bridge and gondola station. Centrally located, the rooms are spacious and the help always friendly. Ask for a corner room overlooking the bridge and adjacent plaza. While not cheap, the pricing is reasonable and a bargain for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with a greate view of the gondalas”
Reviews.Author: Nav531
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in Venice. The hotel is centrally located and easily accessible in the heart of Venice less than 5 mins walking from San Marco Square. It is a boutique hotel, the rooms were spacious and clean. We were able to find a pretty good rate on venere.com for $105 Euro a night and I can definitely say it was worth it. The room had large shutter windows and we were overlooking one of the canals full of gondaliers. In the morning, before everything stated, you could here the gonaliers singing as they prepared their boats. The breakfast was basic european but they also had a coffee machine which was quite good. I would reccomend staying at this hotel if you decide to stay in Venice, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy04
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice to make a cruise so me and husband decide to stay oe day in Venice. I read the reviews here, so choose the Violino hotel based on that and was not dissapointed. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are clean and nice. I would recomend to a friend. Very well located near Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful one-day stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Hermiona_Granger
Reviews.Content: During our trip from Barcelona to Pula we made a 1-day stop in Venice and stayed at the Violino d'Oro Hotel. I have to stay that it was one of the most beautiful hotels I ever slept in. Although one night, but we enjoyed it so much. I'm not sure whether it was just some special offer at that time, but we received also typical Venetian biscuits and a bottle of prosecco at the arrival plus private taxi trip to Murano island. Absolutely recommended! Wonderful location - just few metres from San Marco, very nice and helpful staff, tasty breakfast, so I give 10 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Great But Small!”
Reviews.Author: TheSurvivorFan
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a good hotel in a great area. It is a two minute walk to Piazza San Marco. The rooms are small but our friends had a terrace so it made the hotel feel bigger. My favorite part is the coffe machine that gave you any kind you wanted. It is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Piazza San Marco.”
Reviews.Author: William D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first hotel experience in Venice. It is located a short distance from Piazza San Marco. We arrived at the hotel after traveling more than 24 hours from the west coast of the United States. Our greeting by staff at the front desk was business-like. We were given information about our room, what time breakfast was served in the morning and that we had to turn in our room key each time we left the hotel. After we completed check-in, we were given our room key and it was up to us to get our luggage to our room. No assistance with our luggage was offered by hotel staff. There is a small elevator, which was only big enough for two 28" suitcases and one person. It is common for hotels in the U.S. to provide Internet access for a fee that covers a 24 hour period. Not so at this hotel. You pay for the period of time you want to be connected to the Internet. They have 2 time plans. One plan is 20 hours access for â‚¬60. Unless you are going to be staying for several days and plan to be using the Internet a lot, don't choose this plan. The shorter period plan would be fine because you are only charged for the time you are connected to the Internet. This hotel advertises free transportation to the island of Murano. The free transportation is one-way. You must use public transportation to return to Venice. We had the double superior canal view room. The view is of the canal that runs along the side of the hotel. There are no balconies. The room was very nice. The bathroom had an odd arrangement. The shower was in the corner in front of the toilet. The shower consisted of a shower curtain around a drain in the floor. It was quite interesting taking a shower and trying to keep from getting the toilet paper wet. Although the bathroom looked clean, it didn't smell clean. Given the large number of hotels in Venice, I don't believe I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Olexander
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Violino d'Oro in July 2011 and enjoyed our stay. Hotel is well located close to San Marco so we could easily reach all major tourism destinations. It is also close to water bus stop which is very improtant if you have some luggage (bridges over canals are difficult to cross). After some investigation we used internet in the hotel, 20 hours key costs 6 EUR (time can be stopped after you used internet). Probably one of the cheapest options in Venice as restaurants/cafes usually do not have wi-fi access - but better to use it in common areas as in the room signal often interupts. Breakfast was good, tomatoes with mozarella was our favourite choice. We were a bit disapointed by absence of hot meals (omelets, sourages, etc) but tomatoes with mozarella smoothed overall impression. Room was nicely decored, very quiet but not too large, but as far as I know it is common problem in Venice. We had view over nearby roofs and small street (classical double room) and it was still very nice. Hotel offered us trip to Murano - please beware that you will be transported only one way, way back to hotel you need to use water bus or taxi. Prosecco wine and Biscotti Tipici Veneziani offered as a present by hotel were of good quality and served with ice, we enjoyed it. Overall I recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and romantic”
Reviews.Author: thedaveymac
Reviews.Content: The concierge was very helpful and spoke many different languages. The rooms were nicely decorated. Our room had a private terrace which was nice. The location is great as well, right next to a canal and very close to San Marco. The air conditioning was nice and cold. Near the entrance to the Hotel is a Gondola station which was interesting to watch. The bathrooms were very clean, as were the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Smack in the centre of San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Parhakoo
Reviews.Content: It does not get nearer to San Marco IMHO. Great location and when we got off the water bus/vaporetto with our luggage, we did not have to walk much to get to the hotel. Location is great and easy 5 minute walk to the Ali laguna-which is where one gets the water bus to the Marco Polo airport (this water bus takes about 1 hour and 15 minutes to get to/from the airport and is quite cheap compared to the rip off water taxis). Big room and great washroom. We were only there for a day and location made it possible to explore nearly areas and walk to Rialto with the baby stroller. Very helpful staff. Would stay again probably.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Olena80
Reviews.Content: Just be careful with this hotel - it reminded me Turkey hotels: a lottery with good rooms and bad rooms. Our room looked very sad: deep scrathes on the wall, rusty frame of AC, etc. The personnel didn't show the room and didn't offer any help with luggage - we were so surprised that even didn't find words to say smth. Luckily we stayed there only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravelers63
Reviews.Content: Great location, I mean very very good location. Clean, friendly staff, room 203 was just perfect (view on the canal from two sides). We celebrated our 25th anniversary there and we highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff! We would go back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: krysti0423
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night before we took a cruise out of Venice for the Greek Isles. The location was great, in the heart of a lot of great but expensive designer shops. St. Mark's Basilica & Doge's Palace was a 5 minute walk (if that) and Rialto Bridge was maybe a 10 minute walk. Harry's Bar is also just a 2 minute walk away. The staff at the hotel was great and since it was our honeymoon we were given a free bottle of Prosecco upon arrival. Perfect way to start our honeymoon :) Our room was 210 and we had our own little balcony that was attached to another balcony. Our room wasn't right on the canal but I enjoyed it because we sat out on the balcony under the moonlight and had a few drinks. The hotel serves a free breakfast that included cereals, fruit, jucices, assorted coffee's & teas and meats & cheeses. Everyone was great and helpful and we will def. put this on the top of our list whenever we make it back to Venice. The only con was that it was expensive, $270 euro (about $320 american dollars). I wouldn't normally spend this kind of money but since it was our honeymoon I figured we would splurge and it was worth it :)

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location near San Marco”
Reviews.Author: ssbGg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 203 which was a corner room overlooking a canal with the Moises bridge. We we very pleased with our stay. The price was high (Euro 184 per night) but not too bad for Venice. We felt the breakfast buffet was very satisfying. They have a self-serve machine that made great caffe machiato. They staff was friendly and helpful. They apparently have other properties nearby so I would confirm that you have a room in the actual Violino d'Oro. Location was about a 3 minute walk from San Marco. I would highly recommend this hotel. One caveat, the so-called high speed internet was very slow. However, the charge was 3 Euro for 60 minutes of use which was good enough for us to check our e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “very nice European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: baltlaw
Reviews.Content: The desk staff was very helpful. Breakfast was fine. Place was clean. Very well located near the Piazza del St Marco. Water taxi from the airport lets you off 25 feet from the door....nice if you have a bunch of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: shinney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two night on a trip with our two children aged 3 and 11 months. The hotel is two mins from St Marks Square, only one bridge to cross, a bonus when you have a stroller. The hotel staff are all lovely, all speak english and v v friendly especially to the children. The room was large, set up as requested with one double bed, one single and a travel cot. The windows were high up which meant we couldnt look out them but perfect for us as with children it was one less thing to worry about. There was a rooftop area with seating looking over the canal and several balconies on the landings overlooking canals which was lovely. Breakfast room also looked over the canal, pity there were curtains on the windows. Breakfast was lovely, cold meats / cheeses, cereals, fruit and pastries. We asked hotel staff one night for a restaurant recommendation with the children with not many bridges to cross and they sent us to Vino Vino, only a few streets away, gorgeous food and lovely staff. All in all Id definatley recommend this hotel for families and for couples, great hotel, great location, good price and v friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location, Charm, Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: nyuszimelbourne
Reviews.Content: Excellent friendly , English speaking staff, nothing too much trouble to organise. The location is just steps behind St Marks square. Fantastic abundant breakfast included in cost.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - would stay here again in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: Resumegal
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Violino d'Oro is ideally located near upper end scale shopping, thus a little removed from the tourist crowds located a few blocks away. They recommended a tremendous little restaurant (Vino Vino) a short walk from the hotel that is just wonderful! Very easy to walk right into Piazza San Marco without getting lost. But it is so fun to get lost in Venice! We highly recommend this charming little hotel - well priced, immaculately clean, and excellent staff. Can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: JMMScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights. Chose hotel partly for location. It is very close to Piazza San Marco but since Venice is a reasonably compact place almost any location would be close to a place of interest and might be less touristy than San Marco. Hotel was "OK" but pricey. Room was tiny and poorly lit but comfortable enough. Staff were OK. Breakfasts were barely adequate and served in a very busy and cramped area. No variation from one day to the next and limited choice. Fresh fruit seemed to run out early each day. Machine coffee was mediocre. Arrangements for leaving luggage on day of departure very insecure. It was left at bottom of stairs a few feet from the door and when we went to collect it no one checked who we were or even bothered to say goodbye. No visible management presence throughout the stay in contrast to hotel we had stayed in in Milan where "quality assurance" was clearly a high priority. Perhaps the demand for hotels in Venice is such that management don't feel the need to make the extra efort that could lift the hotel above the level of "OK" to a place you would want to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: johnstoneoooo
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, good location, happy staff, clean rooms, good breakfast. it was our honymoon stay, could not have had a better hotel, will come again and recomend to all our friends

Reviews.Title: “As Good as it Gets for 3-Star in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BizzyM
Reviews.Content: I'm rating this hotel for what it is: a 3-star hotel in Venice...I'm not comparing it to the Ritz-Carlton, just to other 3-star European hotels. That said, we thought it was great! Location, of course, is relative. But for us it couldn't have been better - on a charming side canal, steps to Piazza San Marco and the Grand Canal, and literally looking out onto Versace and Bottega Veneta boutiques. The room was very spacious for a 3-star (we were in room 107), the bathroom was updated and modern. The room stayed true to Venetian charm, with floor-to-ceiling curtains and a Murano glass chandelier. 3-star hotels can always go "one way or the other" and I felt that this one absolutely erred on the nice side. The breakfast was very adequate (I don't remember any hot selections, but lots of juice, cereal, fruit, and pastries - an American-style "continental" breakfast, but not chintzy), but was such a pleasure to be right out over the canal in the breakfast room. If we were going back to Venice and were looking for a 3-star hotel, we'd absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reccomended and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: chriskerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding along with our family and friends. We had been over a few months before and the staff were very helpful then recommending which rooms to book and helping us with the geography of Venice. From start to finish everything went well, the rooms were great we were on the top floor next to the roof terrace. The Reception staff were very helpful on the wedding day chasing around to get us good deal on a Gondola. On the last day there was no trouble storing our bags and keeping our valuables safe. We would stay here again. Good location next to a canal and 5 mins from St Marks Sq.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in perfect Venice location”
Reviews.Author: davidamy94
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Europe and spent 4 nights in Violino d'Oro. The ambience is amazing. The staff are all so helpful and professional- Claudia, Eliza and Luca were wonderful. They had great tips on everything Venice. Breakfast was great-cheeses, salami, bread, fruit, capachino, tomatoes, everything. Gondolas go right by the dining room. The hotel is very romantic. I would recommend this place to everyone. I don't understand how it is only rated 99? It should be rated in the top ten. Lucca recommended La Scala for dinner-best lasagna ever and great host.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: betamagic
Reviews.Content: PROS â€¢ clean room â€¢ comfortable bed â€¢ great location â€¢ nice staff My husband and I stayed here and found the hotel to be perfectly fine. The location is a short walk from San Marco Square (I think our booking site implied that that the hotel was right on the square, which isn't true... ). The staff was friendly and helpful. We were ugraded to a "junior suite" which didn't seem to have any extra amenities, but did have a good amount of square footage for a Venice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better for first-timers”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelmum
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Violino d'Oro and it will probably be our last. The hotel was newly renovated on our first stop. Itâ€™s gotten a bit frayed since then. The rooms are small, dark and filled with the heavy damask drapes and stuffed furniture so common to Venice everywhere. Donâ€™t get me wrong, itâ€™s still an ok and relatively reasonable place to stay in the San Marco area of Venice. Itâ€™s right across a small canal with gondoliers from the Bauer Grunewald, a very chi chi upper bracket place on the square of the San Moise church. The primary problem is its proximity to the Piazza San Marco. And the gondola station right along side it doesnâ€™t help at all. Truly at one point we had to elbow our way through a Japanese tour group standing three or four deep haggling with the gondoliers for prices on their gondola rides. If youâ€™ve been to Venice more than once, you donâ€™t need that kind of hassle. Better to stay on the Dorsoduro and pick up some tiny slivers of neighborhood life and some peace and quiet but without it feeling dead. I think weâ€™ll return to the Ca Pisani there next time. Hereafter I would recommend the Violino d'Oro only to first time visitors to Venice who want to be near the main tourist attractions and especially the Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Siddh123
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after checking out many htls in Venice on the web and we were not disappointed. We stayed fr one night at this htl which was a lovely experience. Fantastic location, St Mark's sq just a few minutes away, opportunity fr window shopping. Breakfast was more or less a CB but quite sufficient. Great staff, clean rooms (in the main building). Over all a great hotel and we will definitely be back....

Reviews.Title: “only quality:location”
Reviews.Author: pasquier2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location BUT never accept the annex : no lift but steep and narrow stairs, One could hear the phone conversations in the next room ...and the sex in the room near my children'room who learned a lot ! The girl at the reception also lied when affirming that I asked for the annex when I told her that I didn't like my room. It rained and we had to walk every time to our room getting soaked . They called our floor a first floor: in front of the roof across the very narrow street.The breakfast room is really small with 2 people tables and very ordinary choice.My " double room" for one person didn't include a seat even a chair.I hated every minute of those five days.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION in Venice”
Reviews.Author: 01Boomer
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Venice - 2 minute walk to Piazza San Marco and Grand Canal and fabulous shopping and restaurants!! Front desk was so fantastic .. we dropped off some luggage early and they held our luggae until our flight left late on our last day in Venice. Huge Rooms for Venice standards and they even arranged a water taxi to the airport that picked us up right our front. THIS IS REALLY IMPORTANT .... because there are no ramps on all the fabulous bridges of Venice therefore ...carrying your luggage up and down every bridge can be exhausting!! Great coffee in the morning and full breakfast too !

Reviews.Title: “Venice is ridiculous and marvelous!! Skip Hotel Violino d'Oro!”
Reviews.Author: jlhrox
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at this hotel in September.. Service- poor and rude. Room- Small and cramped. Staff- smoking on Terrace adjoining ours all day. Breakfast was so crowded everrything get's spilled and so uncomfortable. Internet was broken on arrival and we were told it would be out for the length of our stay.. 3 nights! Go to Venice... it was amazing.. avoid this Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Service, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: mdiver08
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was wonderful. They had many great suggestions as far as food and water taxis, ferry schedules. In fact I found them for informative than the local TI. (Also more friendly)

Reviews.Title: “I was transported into the middle of a living theatre.”
Reviews.Author: Country_girl00
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the lovely reception area the staff were immediately welcoming & professional, attending to our check-in promptly & efficiently. The room was quite magnificent, on a corner overlooking the little square as well as directly over the Moise Canal. It was like stepping back to the 17th century with chandeliers, brocade window drapes and big comfortable bed. The bathroom was spacious & immaculate, and both room & bathroom were attended to each day. The excitement of sight & sound out of the floor to ceiling windows from the gondola station below could also be effectively blocked out by closing the windows & shutters if you wanted to sleep. Thank you Violino D'Oro and staff - Luca, Romina and Claudie for making our last 3 days in Venice so memorable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept Secret in Venice !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pedrocreimon
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel i n Venice, forget the rest. There is a sense of hospitality in this hotel that I did not see in the other hotels we stayed at. Thank you Juanito (owner ) for making us feel at home....Pedro y Damiana (Medico Pediatra de Miami)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: v_liany
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good location..its not too far from San Marco water bus stop, and just next to it is the gondola ride..close to shops too... Apparently the hotel has 2 building so we got the room in the other building bit at the back. Staff was friendly..Pictures in booking.com dont represent our room, or perhaps they only put down pics on the expensive room? Overall its good..though not cheap at all, but then all hotel in Venice are expensive..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: carlafp
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the hotel with family and friends. It was recommended by a local who served as our guide for Venice. The staff was helpful and warm, the rooms clean and beautifully decorated (ours was bit tight, but the kids room was large) and breakfast buffet was ample and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, good value.”
Reviews.Author: homey123
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel and were very pleased with our choice. Just a few minutes walk to Piazza San Marco so very well located - the same distance from the vaporetto stop. Hotel was clean with good sized rooms and the staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again and recommend to any one wanting a not too expensive option in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ChiantiSoul
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed for two days in Venice and this hotel was excellent. The location is great, close to a water taxi station, and it is a good value. We had a window that overlooked the piazza in front of the hotel and it was fun to people watch, especially the gondoliers! We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: adecicco
Reviews.Content: Violino d'oro is a excellent hotel for a quick stay in Venice (or even an extended stay)... The location could not be better (just 100 yards or so to the Piazza San Marco) - the staff is friendly and the rooms are very nice. The complimentary breakfast is beyond compare and the surroundings are quintessentially Venetian. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a relaxed, comfortable stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: AussieDaydreamer
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located and easy walking distance to all the major spots. Breakfast was the stock standard fare. I had a single room which was next to an outdoor area so didnt have a particularly good nights sleep as some guests decieded to have an improptu smoke and drinks session. Not good when all you really want to do is sleep! Nevertheless the room was clean, and comfortably furnished. Service could of been a little better as well - not sure if it was lacking due to the number of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, clean, relaxed atmosphere - perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MinnoDorset
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with another couple, stayed for 3 nights in the Hotel Violino d'Oro. We booked the more expensive rooms overlooking the canal and these were more than adaquate with nice furnishings and a good bathroom, the very 'firm' bed was the only thing they could improve. I'm sure all the rooms would be good and the hotel gave you the impression that it was well run. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast spread was excellent. There is a nice terrace on the roof where we would sit and drink a bottle of the local sparkling wine before going out to eat. The location couldn't be better and it is a very easy walk from the airport waterbus. When we return to Venice we will be coming back to this hotel. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of it Praises”
Reviews.Author: vaudeville
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with a group of 10; I saw four rooms (2 triples, 2 doubles). The location is superb just a couple minute walk from Piazza San Marco and main transit piers! The small hotel is well managed and maintained by a friendly accommodating staff. The price makes it an excellent value. Many rooms front the charming Canal Moise and the hotel sits on one of the best shopping streets of the area on a charming little square with a quintessiential Venetian Church across the canal. If your time is limited (or not) and you want to be in the most central location without spending an arm and a leg, this is the place. The rooms are well furnished in local style. One of the four bathrooms of our group had a somewhat marginal shower, but overall the place was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: AllanLaura
Reviews.Content: Hotel Violino d'Oro is just minutes from San Marco, situated in a quiet square beside a small canal which is used as a meeting point for gondoliers, who start gathering here at about 9am. What a civilised traffic jam! It is pure magic to see these folks preparing their gondolas for the day. Our (upgraded) room immediately looked out over this delightful bustle but there is also a balcony in the adjoining corridor for folks to take in this amazing view. Our elegant room was spacious, very clean and was crowned with a Murano chandelier. We would like to take this opportunity to thank the Violino d'Oro staff (all very helpful, good humoured and polite) for making our holiday so special. We look forward to returning to this wonderful city and to the Hotel Violino d'Oro !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with friendly, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryCamberley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located; only a few minutes' walk from vaporetto stops and St Mark's Square. Staff are pleasant and helpful. The hotel provides a very good continental breakfast which includes cereals, pastries and fresh bread. Disadvantages: rooms in need of refurbishment, bar area has no atmosphere and the thin walls meant that I was kept awake by my neighbouring guest's snoring and/or television!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Schlockette
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was lovely. Our room overlooked the canal and it was great. No problem with noise--once we closed the windows you did not hear a thing. Room was lovely. Nice sized and lovely funriture and even had a chandelier. Furnished in a period style. Bathroom was fine. Great location to walk to all tourist sights and to explore the city from. The only disappointment was breakfast. It was in a non-descript room and there was nothing hot, a bad capicino machine and no fresh fruit at all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tandkDE
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location if you want to stay near St. Mark's Square. Nice to have short walk back to hotel after listening to the "dueling orchestras" on St. Mark's each night. Short walk from St. Marks's Valaresso vaporetto stop. Staff was very helpful and professional (a little stuffy maybe, but that's okay). Cool looking out at one of the side canals (and gondoliers preparing their boats) at breakfast every morning. Breakfast was quite good. Lots of private/public patios on each floor for some quiet time if you desire. Staff was very efficient at getting/checking restaurant availability. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good in all areas”
Reviews.Author: Canada-Korea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for our second wedding anniversary (Our first time in Venice). We found the 3 star hotel was good in all areas. Venice is expensive and we found what we received for our money here is a good deal. Friendly and helpful staff, breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, friendly staff and value...will stay here everytime I'm in Venice”
Reviews.Author: NJOToole
Reviews.Content: From the start, googling Violino d'Oro...the website shows this hotel to be warm and welcoming. It doesn't emphasize, however, the amazing location. It is literally about 4 min walk to St Mark's square...accross the street from the most upscale shops in Venice; a stone's throw to the San Moise Cathedral for those who attend daily mass, IMMEDIATELY on the San Moise gondola/water taxi dock and about 5 min walk to the San Marco Alilaguna line or the Valaresso vaparetto line ! Easy TO GET HERE and accross the canal from the Bauer which is 3x the cost. Our room overlooked the San Moise canal...appointed nicely with mid size Bath...and two lovely windows to give me ample space to photograph wonderful gondola views. Windows open: sounds of Venice. Windows closed, almost silence, enough to nap during the afternoon. Could have been a bit larger, but clean, neat, and well appointed with a VERY attractive entry way with Murano chandelier in hall and over our bed ! Breakfast was wonderful (not hot) but with meat, and fresh kuchen, and assorted fruits and other choices. A wonderful coffee machine to offer coffee/tea ANY way you want it ! Worth the money to get with your room as food in Venice (esp for Americans, just now, is VERY expensive, unless you seek out venues way away from St Mark's sq. Staff very helpful, except we were steared wrong re: mass....... Be aware that Full choir Mass at St Marks on SUNDAY is at 10:30a NOT 11a.! (do not pay to attend mass ...just tell them you are 'here for mass". There is a rooftop 'place' at the hotel, but not really accessible as is it only open occasionally, and is JUST OUTSIDE someone else's room. Hotel is Very near the La Fenice Opra theater, as well as several others for Vivaldi and opras. 5 min to the tourist ctre...where they speak good english and offer helpful advice EASY to get to from the Cruise Terminal. Just take the Blue line.......Alilaguna (just outside the cruise terminal is the ticket box)......to San Marco. Turn left and follow the road straight to the San Moise Bridge...The hotel is just after. (accross from the Hotel Bauer) We fell in love with Venice and staying here helped to make that so !

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: littledarlinseattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early September at the end of our 3 week trip to Italy. This was the most expensive hotel of our trip but certainly not the nicest. The rooms were clean and well decorated, but extremely small and cramped. The bathroom in our room was set up for handicap access and there was no shower stall, just a corner of the room with a shower curtain around it. This made it difficult to keep the rest of the room dry. We had a corner room on the first floor with a view of the canal. I really enjoyed watching the gondoliers in the canal and we often took a glass of wine out onto the small balcony in the hall to enjoy the view. The 3rd floor terrace that is advertised is between two of the 3rd floor rooms and it felt like we were intruding when we went up there. Overall the location was good, but it is in the busiest part of the city and the crowds can be overwhelming during the daytime. The breakfast was probably the worst we had on our entire trip. Very limited choices of cereal and pastries, coffee from a machine, and a very crowded room that was difficult to move around in. The service was friendly but a bit reserved. Overall, after staying in marvelous hotels in Florence and Bellagio (read my reviews on this site) I expected better from this hotel. Although there was nothing really wrong- there was nothing really right either. I think there are probably better experiences out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for us”
Reviews.Author: linnde
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at Violino d'Oro and really liked our room. We had a nice size room, great view of canal and bridge, really soundproof windows and it was cool and clean. We also used the third floor balcony and enjoyed that space as well. Breakfast was good enough. The location was absolutely great, so close to the vaporetto and so close to P.San Marco and everything else. Loved it! Staff very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KaySingy
Reviews.Content: The only reason I chose this hotel was because it had a special nonrefundable rate on hotels.com. All hotels in Venice in July were atleast twice as expensive. No regrets, it turned out to be the best one of all our stays in Europe. This hotel is within a walkable distance from San Marco ferry stop, and from St Marks Square. It is very clean, with a lot of natural light in the corridors, and spacious. Our room was on the second floor, overlooking the gondolas, had a huge king size bed, wonderful fixtures and the bathroom was as big as our entire room in Paris :-). Initially I was worried that the gondola station at the base will be very noisy at night. It was! However, once we closed the windows it was completely dark and quiet. We slept so well that night, we almost missed breakfast. Breakfast was standard, sufficient, and nothing great especailly if you compare it to the fantastic fare you are offered when travelling in Asia. Since we stayed only for a night I cannot comment on the service, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tee70
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel. We had room 301 which is appropriate for a family with two kids. The kids slept in pull-out arm chairs, which was fine for them. We also had a door to the terrace, which apparently was only for us after 8:30 pm. The terrace had chairs, loungers and small tables. Never saw anyone use it except for my kids! This hotel is located right next the the plush Bauer hotel, and the location is great when coming by water bus with luggages. Not too much to walk for the Canale. The breakfast is mediocre at best but we didn't mind it at all. There were an assortment of coffees, pastries, rolls, jams, cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of HIDDEN COSTS”
Reviews.Author: VickieEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the hotel is in a good area...The only BAD experience we had in Italy on our 18 day/8 hotel stay was with THIS hotel's customer service when the night before our checkout my mother who was staying in the same room as my girls was informed that we would be charged and extra 50 euros for a broken screw -in metal swivel leg which was discovered broken by a hotel maid. We had no idea what she was talking about and asked her to show us. It turned out that a leg had indeed broken out of the wood of the bed and we told them that our girls surely did not jump on it it and it must have been like that before or close to breaking as the girls wouldn't jump on it. She said she'd talk to the owner and the next day upon checkout she said we'd be charged 20 euros to replace the metal swivel leg even though we assured her we had not damaged the bed...it must have been wear and tear. We spent 950 euros for three nights stay and left feeling that the customer service of this hotel is poor. Most embarrassing part was to be accused of this behaviour in a very busy lobby and then be charged an extra 20 euros to destroy any positive customer service we'd had up to that point. It almost felt like a cash grab....beware of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect romantic stay at viollino d'oro”
Reviews.Author: neamtzu
Reviews.Content: i was really impressed by viollino....only stayed for 3 nights in a double room..I can only say was perfect, no fault at all..There was also an offer at that time, so the staff welcomed us with a bottle of Prosecco and typical venetian biscuits, so perfect start...The breakfast it's also good..Location is again an extra, cause it's just off San Marco, 150 meters out of Calle Valloroso stop of the vaporetto. Rooms are not so big, but you can feel the class of the hotel. If i think again about the price i paid (around 70 euros a night), i can only say was lucky to stay here...Absolutely recommended, don't hesitate..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, and all non-smoking!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Travel908
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from St. Mark's Square and a Vaporetto stop. There is a gondolla station just steps from the front door as well as high end shopping. The breakfast is great and is well-stocked for the duration. The rooms and the public areas are kept very clean and the entire hotel is non-smoking. I would definitely stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: abha01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is I believe standard in terms of size for most european hotels. It had a small bathroom (one person shower) which is what I saw everywhere when we went to italy. It was clean and the bathroom was pretty modern. The location was superb, you were right across the street from the main piazza. Also the staff was very helpful letting you know where to go and what to see. For the price I think this place was a great value. I would stay here again if I go back to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: Rio1981
Reviews.Content: Hello, me and my boyfriend stayed here on the 6-9 Mar 09 on the first part of our Italy trip. I booked it mainly based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor and was not at all disappointed. As many others have said the location is great, literally 1 min to Piazza San Marco and the same to a vaparetto stop. I was surprised we could get something that good value in this location! I really appreciated this whenever we made our way back from a long day sightseeing as it was always very easy to find, and very easy to get back to by vaparetto from anywhere else in the city. This was also much appreciated when pulling our suitcases on arrival and departure as you don't wanna be lugging them over bridges for half an hour to your hotel. The location is also quite picturesque, right next to canal with various gondeliers and a small square complete with church. Serivce from the staff was very good. We never called on them much as we never needed anything but check in and out was painless, they were friendly and spoke english, which is all you can ask for really. There is also the facility to leave your bags with reception at check out if necessary. The room, no. 111, was very nice. Small, was my immediate thought when walking in which slightly concerned me at first but we soon found out this was still more than adequate for our needs. Furniture was a desk with small TV, no english channels, although it's always more fun to watch the Italian ones anyway, enormous wardrobe which took up about half the width of the room and could have really been done away with to make more space. We didn't use it on our short stay. Bed was large and very comfortable, pillows likewise, we never had trouble sleeping and the lack of any traffic noise outside helps too. :) Bathroom was also small but perfectly useable, very warm, towels were changed every day. Shower was fine, small. Not a problem for us but if you of a larger nature it would be a bit difficult to move around. Both rooms were spotlessly clean and cleaned every day. We had breakfast once, on our last day and I was pleasantly surpised. It was very nice with a good selection of food. Bread rolls, yoghurts, fruit, ham, cheese, orange juice, cereal, and some very nice cake of which I had more than a couple of slices. Overall we thought this hotel was fab. Great location, breakfast, comfy bed, friendly and helpful staff. Only downside was a slightly small room and bathroom, but this didn't affect out stay in any way.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: EJY
Reviews.Content: Located 1 minute from St. Mark's Square, you couldn't really ask for a better location in Venice unless you wanted to camp out in the Doge's Palace. Seriously, this hotel is so centrally located that you wonder why anyone would choose to stay anyplace else. Admittedly, though, the crowds pouring into this sestieri can be daunting, but the friendly staff, clean accomodations, and bustle of the canal right outside the door, make this as welcoming a place as you're going to find. (And, let's not forget how attractive it is to be able to pop into your room for a bathroom break or to just escape the people.) The staff are wonderful and friendly and absolutely welcoming. My girlfriend and I don't really speak Italian, but that wasn't a barrier. (One night we stayed out till 2a - wandering and getting lost in an otherwise-deserted city - making the front desk gentleman wait for us to get back and it wasn't a problem. Sorry, by the way.) The included breakfast buffet is generous and a great way to gear up for your day - just try to get there on the early side, cause it fills up - the line for the coffee machine can be daunting. Anyway, this was an amazing trip and the hotel was a major part of the experience. If you want centrality, accessibility, friendliness, and cleanliness, the Violino d'Oro is for you.

Reviews.Title: “San Marco Bargain with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: haru55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here prior to a 21 day cruise. We were two couples with six major pieces of luggage plus carry ons. The water taxi landing was 50 yards away and across a bridge. Virtually the entire staff of the hotel came out in a rain storm and we were whisked into this charming vintage European Hotel. The charge was 120 Euros for a spot across the canal from the Bauer only five minutes to San Marco Square or the Grand Canal. The front desk was a fountain of local knowledge. The restaurant recommendations were spot on. The hotel is in the midst of a wonderful shopping area with many moderate price eateries. The complementary breakfast is very good. The room was just what you would expect..older with plenty of room and an excellent bathroom. On the day of departure, the rain started again after two beautiful days. Again, our pile of luggage was zipped to the water taxi stand and we said good our good byes to these folks who understand the word hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: maisie_muck
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel in Venice which exceeded our expectations. It was in a fantastic location, just off St. Marks square and close to vaporetto stops as well, but at the same time in a quiet tucked away location. The people at the desk were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was an excellent continental spread and the rooms were really lovely. Ours was very big, very clean and had a large window that opened onto one of the laneways but also had shutters if you wanted a bit of privacy. The bathroom was also very nice and spacious. After the rain and snow when we were there we were always very happy to return to our well heated and lovely room. We got a great deal on this hotel through their own website which included a free bottle of prosecco, so keep your eye on their specials page. I would recommend this place to anyone. It was the best hotel we stayed at in Italy by far, and the cheapest too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Violino d'Oro”
Reviews.Author: mariaej
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, very well located, near San Marcos square. Staff is nice and helpful, room is beautiful, bathroom is super clean and large.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: overstreetjj
Reviews.Content: Good, basic three star hotel. Was in a good location and the staff was helpful and friendly. Would stay again if want a basic, comfortable place to stay while in venice. Close to St. Marks' Square and Harry's Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it! You won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: allegroassai
Reviews.Content: This is a truly charming hotel in the heart of Venice, meaning 2 - 5 minutes walk from S. Marc square, Teatro La Fenice, Accademia.. you name it.. The hotel offers lovely (and pretty large) rooms in typical venetian style, a generous breakfast, friendly staff, all of this and more for a very honest price. This is my first choice every time I stay in Venice. You won't regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: MichaelZurich79
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the centre of Venice. Staff was also very friendly. Breakfast is excellent for Italy. Overall, a very nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Knickster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located within a short distance from St. Marks Square and easy walk from the vaporetta stop. Rooms were small but we had the classic rooms reserved so expected that. Bathroom was very nice but small also but fine for us. No view as expected from what we reserved but very quiet as we were not in the front of the hotel. Breakfast was fine -- pretty much like we experienced in Italy. Staff accommodating --- we were cold one afternoon after out all day and they gladly gave us a pot of hot water for tea. Great place for a two night stay visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....Very good room”
Reviews.Author: bcoops
Reviews.Content: Our two week sight-seeing trip begain at the Violino d'Oro. Once the jet lag and culture shock wore off, we enjoyed our stay. The rooms and bathrooms are quite small and dark, but clean and satisfactory. The lobby and breakfast rooms give you that New York "boutique" hotel feel. The best can be said about the location, around the corner from St. Marks Square. All-in-all, while not located along the Grand Canal, the Violino d'Oro was super convenient, chic looking and clean, a boutique hotel that I would recommend.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Marmaris Turkey, Leros Greece, Cortona Italy (each year)
Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, high standard, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: CaptainPwyll
Reviews.Content: I would stay at no other hotel if and when I return to Venice, I cannot recommend this hotel enough! It is a stone's throw from St Marks and the vaporetto stop is even closer. It is also easy to find. This is a 4 star hotel with a 3 star rating. The lobby and rooms were very well appointed; very clean, comfortable, warm, the bathrooms very new and excellent. We were given a complimentary upgrade but I looked at the other rooms and they were fine. This is an exceptionally good deal in the winter (the best time to visit Venice). The breakfast was very generous and quite good; breads, pastries, cereal, yogurt, (very good strudel) I can't even remember everything that was there. The staff were genuinely helpful and friendly. We left our bags all day and toured until we left for our evening flight. A gem, and a great compliment to our Venice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Rigsy2
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel and were pleasantly surprised at its great location...five minutes from Piazza San Marco. The rooms were on the smallish side but very clean and more than adequate. The linens on the bed were very soft and comfy for a hotel. The bathroom was modern and had everything you would need right down to shampoo, conditioner, hairdryer etc. We enjoyed eating in the very venetian breakfast room and they provide alot of choices to eat. (fruit, cereal, pasteries, cheese, cold cuts etc) The staff were friendly and helpful and provided us with a complimentary city map which proved to be invaluable. A huge plus for us was that this hotel is smoke free!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: FBtravel
Reviews.Content: Violino d'Oro is a very nice small hotel. The staff is friendly and very attentive to guest needs. The rooms are clean and nice enough for a hotel in this price range. We really liked the location, close to everything. The breakfast room and food were excellent. Overall, this is a good selection for your stay in Venice. I only have one issue/recommendation. For US/English speaking guests, the TV coverage should include at least one english speaking network. There was none during our stay and we happened to be there during a transportation strike (so what's new in Italy!). But, we were unable to learn when/if the strike was going to end through the TV. The staff kept us informed, but still one English TV station please!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not 1st choice”
Reviews.Author: DonnaE
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to St. Marks Square on a street with designer stores such as Prada, Ferragamo, Gucci, and more. Gondolas line up on the small canal to the left of the hotel making for a convenient ride from property. You can easily walk to St. Marks but since you're so close, you've also got the crowds outside the hotel to deal with including young student groups. The hotel itself is in good condition but the rooms are very tight and a bit worn. Bathrooms are great however, with nice marble.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bexak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located just off piazza San Marco and the directions from the website were easy to follow. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. If we go back to Venice I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatiian
Reviews.Content: Our room at Violino D'oro overlooked a small canal and its gondoliers and a lovely piazza with lots of light. It is small and cozy and the people are very helpful. Venice is very expensive so we chose this hotel to be in a great location without paying a mint for it. It is right next to the Westin and we had drinks on their terrace overlooking the grand Canal. This hotel is only 2 blocks from St Marks.

Reviews.Title: “All the romance of Venice”
Reviews.Author: BronwenL
Reviews.Content: I cant remember how we got this hotel but it was absolutely last minute (the day before we needed a room). On top of that, we were scrambling to get a room in Venice close to St Marks square because our travel agent had idiotically booked our hotel an hour outside of Venice and it was Carnival weekend. After the disaster in trying to get to Venice the hotel was magnificent. Everything you could hope for and exactly the romantic, Victorianesque, Venitian hide-away anticipated. The price was also stellar at less than 190 Euro including breakfast. The rooms and bathrooms, like elsewhere in Italy, were small but not tiny or uncomfortable. The bedding was luxurious, we looked directly out over a beautiful little bridge and canal, we were steps away from St Marks square, the room was overall lushly decorated and welcoming. The staff were spectacular and the breakfast buffet delicious. The only negative was getting off the water taxi and having to bustle through the crowds in the square with luggage. We soon got over that by taking a Gondola ride from right outside the hotel door. All in all a magnificent stay and the best value possible in the most expensive city on earth. We would gladly stay at Hotel Violino D'Oro again and have recommended it to all our friends. If you can be there for Carnival take the opportunity despite the crowds. It's really spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: austscot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in December - very cold outside but very comfortable inside. Good time to visit - we were lucky enough to have dry weather - bright but cold and the hotel is ideally placed for tramping the streets of Venice. Quiet but central and pleasant staff. We would definitely stay here again. the Chiesa's

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel near Piazza San Marco!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetKen
Reviews.Content: Hotel Violino dâ€™Oro is a fantastic hotel close to Piazza San Marco, the main area of Venice. The hotel is easy to get to and the staff is very friendly and helpful. They also speak English so it will help ease the minds of those who are intimidated to try speaking the language. The rooms and comfy and well appointed; the bathrooms are clean and well lit. The area surrounding the hotel is perfect since itâ€™s close to the main area without being very noisy. I am rarely impressed by hotels, but I was very impressed with this one. The fact that itâ€™s so affordable (using Venice standards) is amazing. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and I very much recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KathyLondonderry_NH
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Violino D'oro was perfect for our one night stay in Venice. The room and bathroom were immaculate and furnished with beautiful spreads and draperies. It was blessedly easy to find. (We saw a lot of desperate people with suitcases looking down narrow alleys for their hotels.) The breakfast was fine. There was a balcony in the hallway where you could watch the gondoliers get their boats ready in the morning. We were able to walk to Piazza San Marco in about two minutes first thing in the morning. We were the first people into the Doge's Palace. Overall, in a town that feels that it's just waiting to rip you off, this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ATLyuppie
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel located right by San Marco square. Perfect in every way. The hotel was very easy to get to with very few directions needed which is a plus in a city with a lot of small streets and bridges. Since it was in Venice and land is hard to come by, I think the hotel was perfectly apportioned. The rooms were a decent size taking that into consideration and the bathrooms, though small were adequate. Also the rooms had a towel heater which we thought was nice. Overall great hotel and a great value in an expensive tourist destination.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Megtobsam
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel very good. The breakfast was not very impressive, the waitress was stressed and even when there were not many guests (second morning) she was still not approachable or friendly. Having said that the reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We paid extra for a superior double and have to say it was disappointing, the decor was tired. Looking at the room plan, it would appear the superior rooms are no bigger than the standard. The corridor is nice and big, but I would prefer less spent on the corridor and more on the rooms. However, we did enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: vosl
Reviews.Content: What a location! We had 2 rooms in the Hotel. One with a canal view that was sensational. Wonderful to open the windows and shutters and look down on the bustling square below and the canal with its gondolas. Our teenage sons had a room with a view of an alleyway but they had opera singers outside their window. The rooms were large by European standards particularly our canal view room which had a foldaway bed as well and still plenty of room. We were in Venice for New Years Eve and the location was superb to get back to the hotel from San Marco Square was so close. However I don't recommend New Years in Venice. The square only had a few exit ways and we felt as though we were going to be trampled to death by the crowds as they left the square. The staff at Violino D'oro are the best . Friendly and very helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. When we return to Venice, we will return to the Violino D'Oro.

Reviews.Title: “New Years in Venice 2008”
Reviews.Author: dmf379
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. It was a short walk to San Marco Square, but... Room was to small for 4 people. Plus I thought it was overpriced for 4 people. 700 euros for 2 nights stay. Breakfast was awful, not enough room for all the guests at one time. That being said, I know it was expensive since it was new years, but we paid for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Venetian style”
Reviews.Author: Cuquish
Reviews.Content: We stood in Venice for 3 nights, and had a really wonderful time at the Hotel. We were given a typical Venetian-style room with all the comforts you can have. Heating was perfect, and so it was hot water. Breakfast included fresh croissants, juice, coffee, cereals, yogurt, bread, good butter, and typical cakes. It was truly a pleasure to have your breakfast with such wonderful meals. We have no complaints about the service, all the staff was really helpful and kind. However, I should warn you from making international phone calls from the hotel, since I made a 7 minute-call and had to pay almost 80 euros!! The hotel is perfectly located, just a 4 minute walk from San Marco Square, and is easily reached from the Vaporetto stop "Pl. S. Marco". Otherwise you can have a bit of adventure and go walking directly from "Pl. Roma" through the pintoresque alleys. You may get lost, but in Venice it is truly worthy to know some of the B-sides of the city which you would never visit in tour guides. One tip: don't forget to asf for the map at the reception. And they offer a free trip to Murano if you tell them the night before! (unfortunately we couldn't take it for free as on sundays there is no boat service for the hotel). So, if we go back to Venice one day, we'll definitely go to Violino d'oro!

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is it”
Reviews.Author: Lois267
Reviews.Content: So glad I read the rave reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor. Began our stay at the Westin Regina Europa, but much too expensive. So we moved to the Violino, which is just around the corner, and we were delighted. Beautiful rooms, incredible location. You really know you are in Venice. Terrific staff. Small lobby and rooms smallish, but the decor and lively and fun atmosphere around the hotel made the experience just perfect. The price is affordable. The breakfast is good. Look no further if you want the Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: mercedmike
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value. Prices in Venice are outrageous. It is very hard to find a nice hotel in the San Marco area at a good price. The Violio D'oro is just a block from St. Marks Square, right next to a gondola stand, next to a beautiful church, and, for those who care, only steps away from Gucci, Versace and Prado!! We checked rates at the Bauer Hotel, just across the canal, and the people there were paying more than double what we were. The room was small but comfortable and had nice amenities like towel warmers. The breakfast was a typical European continental breakfast, and the staff were very helpful, even carrying our luggage to the water taxi for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CheBird
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. I'm so glad I chose it - I was having second thoughts leading up to our trip because not a lot of people here raved about it. We really enjoyed our stay. The staff is very nice and helpful, especially Claudia. The location is ideal. I don't think it's even a 2-minute walk to San Marco. It's also a quick walk to the vaporetto stops, so it's really convenient with luggage. We booked a superior room. It was larger than most we've had in Italy with a very nice bathroom and shower. We were in room 104 directly over the small canal and the gondola stop. Warning if you book a room over the canal: there is a LOT of activity at that gondola stop. We could clearly hear the gondoliers talking and singing all day long... I just loved it, but my husband would have prefered a quieter room. So if you prefer more peace and quiet, don't get a room on the canal! Some cons: hard mattress and no dresser in our room. Biggest pros: location, staff, convenience. Pro and Con, all in one: it's in a very expensive area (yes, all of Venice is expensive, but this hotel is nestled in with Gucci and Chanel. The restaurants in this area are extra-expensive). Bottom line, I highly recommend this hotel as our experience was just great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service but a little worn.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling07
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Hotel Violino D'Oro in September. The location is fabulous -- near San Marco Square and only a short walk from the Vaparetto stop. The room itself was small -- two beds with an inch between them and barely enough room to walk around the end of the bed -- (although the bathroom was pretty decent in size and condition) and a bit tired looking. The customer service was good and pretty accomodating. After discovering a snaffu with our dinner reservation one night, one of the hotel staff ran from the hotel to find us and redirect us to the correct restaurant and another made sure our group could have a light breakfast before a pre-normal breakfast time departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: rjalv
Reviews.Content: We are very glad we chose Violino D'Oro for our 2-night stay in Venice. Location was excellent, only a a couple of hundred meters from San Marco square, very close to taxi and vaporetto stops, and right next to a gondola stop. Staff were courteous and helpful. We had a king size bed and a single bed in a nice, quiet room. Everything fit well, but tight. It was the most expensive hotel we stayed at during our summer vacations, but hey, Venice IS expensive! and we don't regret it. Overall it was a great experience.
