Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location makes this a perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ceeceerose
Reviews.Content: When I was in Venice before, I was fortunate enough to get a great hotel right around St. Markâ€™s Square. I knew that this time, I again wanted to be near the Square, which I feel is the heart and soul of the city. Since I was heading to Venice in Summer rather than Winter like my previous trip, hotel prices were quite a bit higher, especially for the St. Markâ€™s area. But, I found this hotel through a guide book and, aside from being a good deal, it seemed to be a little gem in the center of Venice . And, a gem it was. We were extremely pleased with this hotel â€“ for the location and also for the room size, amenities, and pleasant staff. I would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Julie94
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a wonderful 3 nights in Venice in May 2007 and really enjoyed this hotel. It met all our requirements in terms of budget, location and quaint appeal. It was easy to reach from the Alilaguna airport ferry stop at San Marco even with luggage. Room only had a shower but we had a small private terrace. It would be great if the hotel put safes in each room. Cappuccino's at breakfast were divine. Venice really is a must see destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent design”
Reviews.Author: suattulek
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the hotel with my wife and son (19 years old.). Hotel is designed just fitting to Venice's classical style. Rooms were not big nor small, but clean and comfortable. Every floor has a hall between the rooms, and a balcony connected to that. So you can sit, and enjoy the hotels good view to the canals (Hotel is built just near a canal actually, and canals don't smell bad as they say) Hotel has a standard breakfast service at ground floor, everything is tasty and fresh. Best thing is hotel is just at the center of Venice and near to San Marco. You can easily walk everywhere on Venice. So I think it is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tweets
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Violino d'Oro while on a family trip to Venice for 2 nights. Booked a triple room and added a fourth bed after we checked in. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. I had emailed the hotel several times for directions prior to the visit. Excellent location just 5 minute walk from the Calle Valleresso waterbus stop at San Marco (St. Mark's Square). Located in a nice clean area in the same area as the designer shops (Gucci, Louis Vuitton, etc.) Great location with a gondola stop at its doorstep (but is quite expensive compared to other gondola stops) and just minutes walk to San Marco. Inside the hotel.. There are about 5 steps to get to the elevators from the lobby and then from the elevator level to the room was another few steps.. so if you are unable to lift your luggage or unable to take the stairs, keep this in mind. The room was very small, but clean. Bathroom was a good size. Interior looks just like the website photos. Breakfast was great. A good selection of fresh variety of juices, deli meats/cheeses, chocolate filled croissants, cereals, yogurt, coffee cake, bread, and fruit. The cafe americano and cappuccino were good. i'd recommend this hotel and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Venice weekend”
Reviews.Author: janeobrien
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great but in a very very in expensive area. My tip would be to check out further a field for your evening meals unless you want to pay through the nose for O.K food. Our room also smelt of smoke and this is a none smoking hotel. We did manage to change rooms but only after the staff questioned us quite abruptly on if we had touched anthing in the room. With this said, we had a great stay, breakfast basic but adiquate, clean room and bathroom and gondala's are just outside for a trip around the area.

Reviews.Title: “A room with character and pretty public balcony”
Reviews.Author: GelatoSF
Reviews.Content: Note: they do NOT turn the AC on until May. It wasn't super hot in April, but really warm and stuffy unless you leave the windows open. But then you worry about mosquitoes and the noise outside... If the AC was on, I would have given them 4 stars. -Room and Hotel in general is beautiful. -Centrally located in the St. Marks area. But if you have a lot of bags to carry, I would recommend a hotel closer to the Vaporetto stop. Also, for the better restaurants, I had better luck outside the St. Marks area. The trick is to NOT go to restaurants where waiters are standing outside inviting you in or where they advertise 'menu touristas'. The good restaurants locals go to are served by the owners and few staff, too busy to stand outside pulling in business. -a Public Balcony that has a gorgeous view of a canal that leads to the Grand Canal, where a line of gondolas are ready to pick up passengers. -Quiet in the evenings -Breakfast looked better than it tastes. They offered a lot here, including croissants (filled with sweet almond paste), deli meats (ok...), cereal (too sweet), bread, jams, and fresh fruits (best part) and cappucino (good too). -Front desk service was inconsistent. An older man recommended a restaurant (conveniently gave us a card) that was owned by his friend (we didn't go there, looked touristy). A younger man told us about a restaurant that was hidden behind an alley where the locals go, that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: ljmOrlando
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our 3 days in Venice. The hotel was absolutely perfect! Great location, friendly staff, and very nice breakfast. The best part was one evening we returned from dinner and had our windows open because the weather was perfect. Our room overlooked the street. On the corner across from the hotel was a lady singing opera....it flowed into our room and was absolutely dreamy!! She sounded amazing and just being in Venice and hearing that was awesome! Would go back there in a hearbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “a location to die for(perfect)”
Reviews.Author: dozydai
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night break at the violino doro, the location must make it one of THE places to stay in venice, it looks out over the rio san moise and the location in perfect. To get to the hotel from the Vallaresso water bus stop,walk up the calle larga 22 marzo to the bridge and square, and the hotel is in front of you a mere, 7 or 8 minute walk,wonderful location for sightseeing, ideal for most of the sights in the city. The hotel has 26 bedrooms, split into three types, classic, superior with views over the rooftops, and superior with views over the canal and square,we paid 120euros per night for the superoir with views over the roof topsand booked direct with the hotel as it was the cheapest way, room given was a suite, the room was spotless and the bed comfy, with plenty of room and even a spare bed(if i had of known i would have brought my mother in law???),good size bathroom with shower and bath. breakfast room had tables looking out over the canal so you could watch the gondoliers prepare their craft whislt you ate breakfast, which was a typical italian hotel breakfast with plenty of variety and good for setting you up for the day. one downside is that the safe for the room is in a room off the reception, would of thought nowadays that safe in room was standard. In conclusion, the hotel was perfect for location, very clean with pleasant staff always willing to help you have a nice stay,enjoyed it and will use again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Irish_traveller21
Reviews.Content: Just back from great 3 night stay in Violino D'Oro. Arrived late to be greeted by friendly night staff. Room was standard double room - not massive but we've stayed in smaller. Bathroom was modern - compact but easily met our needs. Room overlooked small square with Gondola station which was a plus - with double/triple glazing, room was very quiet (although cleaners in the morning were noisy but thats the same the world over and it was time to get up anyway!) Breakfast was as we expected - cereal, yoghurt, bread, croissants, ham, cheese, coffee, tea - which set us up well for the day. All staff were very helpful and pleasant. Location is fantastic - 2 minutes to St Marks' Square. 3 nights B&B for 250 euro in total - you'd be hard pressed to get any better value in Venice. We'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD/Left Early”
Reviews.Author: Re123
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one and only one good feature; the location - it is right on the canal & near shops- but Venice is not that big and a two minute walk can get you to the canal & shops anyway. The room was smaller then my college dorm. The T.V was the size of the T.V in my truck and the remote did not work. The bathroom was old, tight, and did not have a tub ( i mean the floor of the bathroom had a drain with a shower head mounted on the wall surrounded by a curtain). We actually left a night early and lost money. I've stayed in $35.00 motel 6 before and would chose the Motel 6 over Violino. I would never stay there again. Find a different hotel - No matter what the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs a bit of updating”
Reviews.Author: washashorecapecodma
Reviews.Content: Our room looked like the picture on the internet but it was rather a tight fit. The bed was comfortable, the storage space was minimal. We overlooked the square which was nice and not noisy in spite of the crowds in September. Room could stand a bit of freshing up. It looked well used. Bathroom was tiny but immacutely clean. Breakfast was just ok. Selection doesn't vary and we stayed for 4 nights. Coffee and rolls were good so who needs more? The staff was extremely helpful especially Gianni the night desk person. He suggested places to eat and sites to see. And every evening it was a treat to see and talk with him on our way out to dinner. It rained the last day as we were leaving Venice and one of the staff helped us to a water taxi, which the hotel had reserved for us. He carried my bag, which was heavy, a long distance through back alleys to the boat. Location is great near everything. You can walk all over Venice from here. It was expensive, over $300/night in September. We had a much better deal in Rome and a much nicer room there. But this is Venice and it is a very expensive city. I would stay again, but not in the high season.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Violino!”
Reviews.Author: dreamdoll
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy where we stayed at the lovely Hotel Violino for part of our honeymoon in Venice! Even though we were only staying for a night, they had prepared a chilled bottle of sparkling wine. The lady at the counter was also very helpful and friendly! Breakfast was decent and I would say overall it's been value for money, beautifully and tastefully done up, very venetian - perfect! Our hotel room was exactly what it looked like shown in the hotel website photos (don't expect huge rooms as I think almost all places in Venice are smaller in size anyway), and the location was excellent with the hotel just being a short walk away from San Marco, and but a stone's throw away from all the boutiques! The weather was slightly damp for us this time in Winter, but the wonderful location meant that we could walk almost anywhere and everywhere! I loved the view out to the small canal outside our window, where we could see some gondolas in the day, and I wish we had more time in Venice and the hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travellers for a romantic stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “The Violino d'Oro was perfect”
Reviews.Author: capecod1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year as part of a large family trip and loved it. The staff was very welcoming and friendly and not upset by the fact that they had to speak to us in English. The rooms were clean and very well-equipped. The lobby and overall hotel decor was amazing. Even the room key was neat - heavy and ornate (unfortunately we couldn't keep it as a souvenier). We had a corner room overlooking the adjacent canal and small plaza and the view was great. At night, we even got serenaded to sleep by the smooth sounds of a musician playing his cello in the plaza. We'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value”
Reviews.Author: cindyelizabeth
Reviews.Content: The Violino d'Oro is an excellent location! Steps from San Marco yet none of the heavy tourist traffic nor noise. Probably most important was the ease of getting there with luggage. Very close to the San Marco vaporetto stop with only one smallish bridge to lug your stuff over. A bonus was the elevator. While the room was very spacious (triple with plenty of room for our 18-year old daughter, myself and husband), the shower is small. Despite this my husband (6'5 and about 235 lbs) managed just fine. Breakfast was quite good. The beds were wonderful! Although a little worn in spots, it was exceptionally clean and neat and the value was unbeatable! Venice is an expensive city (we spent an average of 160 euros/night for dinner--typically only 2 courses and wine) so we felt we got a terrific value for stay at Violino d'Oro. We bought the Venicecard which was handy for getting to Venice from the airport (by bus) and then to the hotel but found that after boarding the vaparetto from the bus station, we were never asked to show proof of purchase so you could probably easily get away with buying a one-way ticket on the vaparetto. One the other hand, the Venicecard allowed us to skip long lines to buy tickets to Doge Palace, etc. as well as freely travel back and forth from island to island. Beware, however, the vaparetto can be VERY crowded with lots of pushing. My purse (thank God without our passports in it!) was stolen on our ride in the vaparetto to the train station to leave Venice. It was a large bag and I had it looped over my luggage handle along with several other bags. I still can't figure out how or when it was stolen during that relatively short boat ride. . . My advice would be to never have it off your person and have at least one hand holding it tight.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Violino d'Oro
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco, 2091 | Campiello Barozzi, 30124 Venice, Italy
